channel.title: Uncategorized on Drunkturtle.com
channel.description: Recent content in Uncategorized on Drunkturtle.com
channel.copyright: © This post is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

item.title: A Big Change!
Back to School
item.description: On the first of this month I started school again. I started an Associates Degree ICT Management. It is a part-time study next to my day job. I spend one day in school, from 13:00 till 22:00, and 4 days in work. Next to that we get a lot of homework. The subjects for now are all very interesting: - Python - Cloud Computing - Cisco - ITIL ITIL is a quite dry subject, but its giving me a lot of insight into the processes at work.

item.title: Busy, busy, busy
item.description: Time fly’s when your having fun! Its been over 2 months since I made a post, not really what I was planning on. It’s not like I’m having writers block, I just haven’t found the time to write. Between work and the house and me being lazy I’m just to busy =) The current programming language Drum roll… is JavaScript! As posted before, I’m trying to make an App for my wife.

item.title: C# Programming
item.description: Last week I finished my edx.org course C# programming from Microsoft. It was a fun course, and it showed me that programming is a bit like riding a bike. Once I was going, it all was very familiar. Its not so strange I guess, all the Object Oriented Programming ideas are the same for any language, C# or Java (I learned Java in school). The course itself was given on the edx platform, but it was one of the first MOOC’s Microsoft gave.

item.title: Moved to WordPress
item.description: Today I decided DrunkTurtle needed to move. I liked the simplicity of Ghost, but I was missing some things. It were small things, but things I wanted non the less. So, now were running on Wordpress :)

item.title: Learning C#
item.description: Over the last couple of weeks, I have been learning how to program in C#. I’m following a course over at edx.org that is given by Microsoft. In the past I have been looking at C# a number of times, as it is a nice medium between C and Java. Following this course has brought back a lot of the stuff I was taught in school about programming, but we were learning Java back then.

item.title: Small update
item.description: Today I made a small update to the site. After trying to find a nice theme, I settle on the StayPuft theme. I already made some small changes, reducing the posts on the front page to maximum a 100 words with a read more link, and I’m looking into changing the colour and layout of the page. The other change is that I integrated Disqus comments into the site so you can start to give me some feedback!

item.title: Asus T100 and Linux
item.description: For some time now I own a Asus T100 Laptop. It’s a nice and small machine running Windows 8. After having used it for a couple of months with Windows 8 (and 8.1) it works good. I don’t have a lot of problems with the Metro interface, as it still supports my workflow without any problems. I honestly think that this is the longest I have had a device running it’s stock software since my Windows XP machine.
